com.github.bordertech.wcomponents

Class AbstractWMultiSelectList

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.AbstractWComponent
      • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.WBeanComponent
        • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.AbstractInput
          • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.AbstractWSelectList
            • com.github.bordertech.wcomponents.AbstractWMultiSelectList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BeanAware, BeanBound, BeanProviderBound, DataBound, Disableable, Input, Labelable, Mandatable, WComponent, WebComponent, Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    WCheckBoxSelect, WMultiDropdown, WMultiSelect

    public abstract class AbstractWMultiSelectList
extends AbstractWSelectList
    AbstractWMultiSelectList provides the basis for components that allow the user to select multiple items from a list.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Jonathan Austin
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • getValueAsString

        public String getValueAsString()
        Returns a string value of the selected item for this users session. If multiple selections have been made, this will be a comma separated list of string values. If no value is selected, null is returned.
        Specified by:
        getValueAsString in interface Input
        Overrides:

        Overrides:

        Returns:

      • getValue

        public List<?> getValue()
        Returns a List of the selected options. If no options have been selected, then it returns an empty list.

        As getValue calls getData() for the currently selected options, it usually expects getData to return null (for no selection) or a List of selected options. If the data returned by getData is not null and is not a List, then setData will either (1) if the data is an array, convert the array to a List or (2) create a List and add the data as the selected option.

        getValue will verify the selected option/s are valid. If a selected option does not exist, then it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Specified by:
        getValue in interface Input
        Overrides:
        getValue in class AbstractInput
        Returns:
        the selected options in the given UI context.

      • getData

        public Object getData()
        Returns the data for this component. The following are searched in order:
        • a value set explicitly in the ui context using WBeanComponent.setData(Object);
        • if a bean is available; the bean's value; or
        • the value set on the shared model.

        getData expects the data to be either null (for no selection) or a List of selected options.

        getData will check that if no options have been selected (ie data is null) and the list component requires an option to be selected (ie AbstractWSelectList.isAllowNoSelection() is false), it will return a list containing the first option as the default selected option. If the data is an empty list or an empty array, then it will be treated the same as there being no selection.

        Specified by:
        getData in interface DataBound
        Overrides:
        getData in class WBeanComponent
        Returns:
        the current value of this component for the given context

      • setData

        public void setData(Object data)
        Sets the data that this component displays/edits.

        setData expects the data being passed in to be either null (for no selection) or a List of selected options. If an empty list is passed in, then it will be treated the same as null.

        If the data is not null and is not a List, then setData will either (1) if the data is an array, convert the array to a List or (2) create a List and add the data as the selected option.

        setData will verify the selected option/s are valid. If a selected option does not exist, then it will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        If the list component requires a selection (ie AbstractWSelectList.isAllowNoSelection() is false) and the data being set is null and null is not a valid option, then setData will throw an IllegalArgumentException.

        Specified by:
        setData in interface DataBound
        Overrides:
        setData in class WBeanComponent
        Parameters:
        data - the data to set which is usually a List containing the selected options or null for no selection.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the data Object is not null but the options List is null or empty.

      • doHandleInvalidOption

        protected List<?> doHandleInvalidOption(Object invalidOption)
        Handle the situation where a selected option is no longer a valid option.

        By default, this method throws an IllegalStateException.

        This method can be overridden to handle an invalid option without throwing the exception. It must return a list of valid options that will be set as the selected options.

        Parameters:
        invalidOption - the invalid option
        Returns:
        the list of valid options to be set as the selected options

      • doHandleRequest

        protected boolean doHandleRequest(Request request)
        Specific handle request processing for an input component is provided here.

        Input components are required to determine if the component has changed in the request, set the component data to the new value (if changed) and return the changed flag.

        Specified by:
        doHandleRequest in class AbstractInput
        Parameters:
        request - the request being responded to.
        Returns:
        true if the input component has changed, otherwise return false

      • getRequestValue

        public List<?> getRequestValue(Request request)
        Provide the value of the component on the Request.

        If the component is not on the request, the components current value will be provided.

        Parameters:
        request - the request being responded to.
        Returns:
        the value of this component on the Request, or its current state if it is not on the request.

      • getOrCreateComponentModel

        protected AbstractWMultiSelectList.MultiSelectionModel getOrCreateComponentModel()
        Retrieves the model for this component so that it can be modified. If this method is called during request processing, and a session specific model does not yet exist, then a new model is created. Subclasses may override this method to narrow the return type to their specific model type.
